description: In front of a store, an elderly man in a hat and coat is riding a coin-operated rocking horse, similar to those typically used by children. Two adults and a child are waiting behind him. The scene presents an absurd inversion of expected behavior, highlighting a moment of peculiar adult indulgence or regression in a mundane setting, contrasting sharply with the waiting family.
caption: “Oh, all right, Barnaby! ... One more quarter and then we’re going home!”
